name: Grenada Grand Beach Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Grenada Grand Beach Hotel in October 2009, and had an amazing time.
reviews.title: amazing veiws, amazing hotel

reviews.text: The service we had was amazing,and staff polite and helpful.
reviews.title: Doorway to Grand Anse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a suite which was massive and had a balcony which overlooked the beach,the veiws and sunsets were beautiful.
reviews.title: Excellent, if you can get it at a reduced rate

reviews.text: The only thing about our holiday is how hot it was and how many moskitos were around.
reviews.title: Stressed free

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definatly stay at this hotel again,the location was great and would recomend anyone else to stay here too.
reviews.title: Beautiful beach and great food!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: went with virgin through lets go 2 .stayed in room with sea view.exellent views over st george.hotel was very quiet we stayed room only restraunts close by .plenty of banks to change money.local mini bus to st george every few mins.easy to hire car and get round this was our 2nd trip would love to go back again
reviews.title: white sand blue sea heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel on a recommendation from a friend and were amazed at the value for money that this place delivers. Perfectly located on the Grand Anse beach, it is well looked after, clean and comfortable. Traveling in the quiet season, it sometimes felt like we had the place and the beach to ourselves.
reviews.title: Can't beat the Grand for Location and Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite the fact that the hotel is about 20 years old now (you notice it in some of the finishings and slightly dated rooms), it is in good condition, kept very clean, such that it does not feel it's age.
reviews.title: beautiful resort
A Grand Paradise at The Grenada Grand
reviews.text: The only downside was the service, which was generally slow. Check in took 20 minutes, waiting for one person ahead of us in the queue (that said, we were allowed to check in at 7.30am, and were given a better rate on arrival which was excellent). We also had a 45 minute wait to be served for breakfast on one day due to not enough staff for the number of guests. Better service would have given this review a score of 5. Service is key.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall though, definitely recommended.
reviews.title: underrated on this site

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at Grenada Grand 2/6 through 2/13. Our room was a beach view and we could hear the waves at night while we slept which we loved. The hotel was fairly empty so we felt as if we had the resort to ourselves most of the days. The breakfast was delicious although it was expensive but worth it since there are not too many other options nearby. We tried to eat at other places most nights since the food was expensive at the hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially the front desk. They are in the process of updating the rooms. Our room needed some updating, especially the bathroom. We had some challenges keeping the bathroom door closed but everything else worked. The shower curtain was flimsy and the tub looked like it needed to be bleached. The room was very clean and our bed was comfortable. We would stay there again because the access to the beach is perfect. I spent several morning jogging or walking along Grand Anse Beach. It really is one of the most beautiful beaches. Further down the beach the water was rougher but right outside the hotel is was perfect for swimming and floating.
reviews.title: Couldn't ask for a better location!

reviews.text: I am lucky to have generous parents who paid for myself, son( 3 months) and daughter (3 years) to stay with them and some friends at this hotel.
reviews.title: Good Hotel let down by a few things

reviews.text: The reception area in the hotel is fabulous. Actually the grounds that the hotel is in is amazing. I frequently saw members of the gardening company on site and all their hard work pays off.
reviews.title: pleasant stay

reviews.text: The hotel is located on the beach, which is great with children. Also it has 3 pools. What lets the hotel down is some of their staff member. Sometimes a smile and willingness to help goes a long way.
reviews.title: Never Again

reviews.text: I must say that "Mary" who works in the restaurant was always smiling and it was a pleasure to have her serving us. Also "Lucille" was another member of staff who truly stood out to me. She was always happy and helpful.
reviews.title: Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this resort for 2 weeks starting on December 31, 2009. Having traveled to many various all-inclusive resorts in Cuba, and Mexico we were looking for a different kind of vacation as we don't drink and are very keen on healthy food, hence did not want to be part of a typical all-inclusive again. We also wanted to explore a new and different kind of island.
reviews.title: Excellent Way To Explore Grenada, Resort Needs Work

reviews.text: So from that perspective, Grenada is a truly beautiful island. The mountains, the rain forests and the white sand beaches with crystal waters truly make this a place to go and see. The people are generally nice too.
reviews.title: Amazing location gateway to Grand Anse

reviews.text: Now as for the resort, there is a lot to be said to manage your expectations properly. We got this resort on an auction site and it was half price if not less, had we bought it through an agent's package. So for us due to this amazing deal, we overlooked the bad. However, I would not necessarily recommend this resort for regular price. One other thing that was great for us was that when we were there, the resort was pretty much empty, so we literally barely saw any people in it. It is like we had the whole place to ourselves. We were literally the only ones in the pools at least 12 of the 14 days we were there.
reviews.title: An Amazing Find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here is a summary of the good and bad:
reviews.title: should have listened to the reveiws

reviews.text: LOCATION: Fantastic. It is right on Grand Anse Beach, has a grocery store/small mall across the street, and another grocery store/mall about a 10 minute walk down the street. There are also about a handful restaurants in the area within walking distance. The main city is about a 20minute drive by bus. (Buses are $1 US and they catch you, you don't have to catch them, so transportation is super easy and cheap to go downtown - not that there necessarily is anything that attractive downtown.) I more recommend going on some tours to see the island. The resort is also a short 15minute ride from the airport by taxi.
reviews.title: HORRIBLE

aka: Grenada Grand Beach Hotel Grand Anse
description: Centrally located in downtown Grand Anse on 20 Acres of prime flat beachfront land, the Resort boasts the convenience of being opposite several shopping centers, banks, restaurants and businesses. With affordable rates, WIFI everywhere, 2 miles of sugar white beach, water-sports and PADI diving centre, tennis courts, a 300ft freeform swimming pool with swim-up bar and savoury cuisine, come and experience why this is Grenada’s best value on your next getaway.
